intro: Baphia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
